marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content:
1. BEI Director Iman Rachman said the exchange is considering extending trading hours from 09:00-16:00 WIB to 08:00-17:00 WIB to attract foreign investors, increase trading volume, and allow investors to respond to global events in real time.
2. BPI CEO Rosan Roeslani said 20% of Danantara's total capital will be allocated to overseas investment while 80% will focus on strategic domestic projects. The company has US$7 billion of capital from dividends and can leverage up to 5 times, equivalent to a potential investment fund of US$35 billion per year.
3. China's National Bureau of Statistics reported retail sales grew +6.4% YoY in May 2025 (vs. April +5.1% YoY), the strongest growth since December 2023, driven by holiday spending during Labor Day and the Dragon Boat Festival and government measures to mitigate U.S. tariff pressures.
4. China's National Bureau of Statistics reported the unemployment rate fell slightly to 5% in May 2025 (vs. April 5.1%), below the consensus estimate of 5.1% and the lowest level since November 2024.
5. Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources set the Coal Price Reference (HBA) for the second period of June 2025 down -10.7% MoM to US$98.61 per ton, also -2.3% compared with the first period of June 2025.

marketNews.title: Story-Driven Valuation: Buying the Future at Today's Price
marketNews.content: "Valuasi murah bukan jaminan aman kalau manajemennya sembrono dan bisnisnya tak jelas arahnya." - fadhilonn

tickerNews.title: BBCA 5M25: Net Profit Bank Only +16% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) reported net profit for the bank-only segment of IDR 5 trillion in May 2025 (+12% YoY, +10% MoM). This result brings the bank-only net profit for the first five months of 2025 (5M25) to IDR 25.2 trillion (+16% YoY). Excluding dividend income, net profit for 5M25 grew +10% YoY, higher than the consensus estimate for consolidated 2025 net profit of +6.6% YoY. Net Interest Income (NII) and Non-Interest Income (Non-II), excluding dividend income, grew solidly by +7% YoY each during 5M25. Operating expenses (OPEX) remained efficient, increasing only +4% YoY during 5M25. Consequently, Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP), excluding dividend receipts, rose +8% during 5M25. Including dividends, Non-II grew +22% YoY during 5M25. Although dividends from subsidiaries are recorded as Non-II in the bank-only financial statements, they will be eliminated in the consolidated statements. Monthly, both Net Interest Margin (NIM) and credit cost (CoC) improved after the April 2025 spread widening. NIM was 5.86% in May 2025 (vs. April 5.56%), while CoC was 0.18% in May 2025 (vs. April 0.59%). This yields a 5M25 NIM realization of 5.73%, in line with the 2025 management guidance of 5.7-5.8%. CoC realization for 5M25 was 0.37%, still above the 2025 guidance of 0.3%. BBCA's liquidity remains good with a Loan-to-Deposit Ratio of 80% and a CASA ratio that rose to 83.2% in May 2025, supported by Current Account growth of +12% YoY, +4% MoM. The solid liquidity supports credit growth of +12% YoY in May 2025. Key Takeaway: The bank-only performance of BBCA in 5M25 is considered positive. NIM is within guidance, CoC is still above guidance but improving in May 2025. Loan growth remains strong though slowing in line with management targets. Interest income rose to IDR 8 trillion in May 2025 (+9% YoY, +4% MoM), indicating a possible rise in lending yield, as noted by management.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Considers Quasi-Reorganization to Address Balance Sheet Deficit
tickerNews.content: Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Herwin Hidayat, said the company is studying a quasi-reorganization option to tackle a balance-sheet deficit of US$760 million (IDR 12.4 trillion) at the end of 2024. He added that the company aims to achieve a surplus on return on risk by 2028, or within the next 5-6 years, so that dividend distribution can be carried out within the next five years. BRMS targets its underground gold mine in Palu, Central Sulawesi, to start operating in 4Q27. The mine is estimated to have a gold grade of 3.5-4.9 grams per ton, higher than the 1-1.5 g/t typical of open-pit mines. With this potential, BRMS projects gold production to increase to 150,000 troy ounces in 2028 and 200,000 troy ounces in 2029, compared with the 2024 realization of 64,983 troy ounces.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Lifts First Oil Production from Forel Field in South Natuna Sea
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional announced that the company successfully performed the first oil lifting from the Forel oil-gas field in the South Natuna Sea Block B. Production from this field has reached 10,000 barrels of oil per day, representing about 6.7% of the total gas and oil production in 1Q25, which stood at 150,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day. The Forel field was officially inaugurated by President Prabowo Subianto on 16 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Plans Private Placement to Fund Malacca Strait Drilling
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada announced that funds raised from a planned private placement will be used by the company's subsidiary to finance drilling activities in the Malacca Strait Block as well as to procure goods and services outside of the drilling activities. In this corporate action, ENRG will issue approximately 2.5 billion new shares, but the execution price and prospective investors have not been disclosed. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 26 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: UBS Transfers Approximately 14.1 Billion BUMI Shares, Increasing Ownership to 6.66%
tickerNews.content: UBS Group AG announced the transfer of about 14.1 billion Bumi Resources shares on 5 June 2025. UBS explained that the transaction was intended by its client to consolidate assets through UBS. After the transaction, UBS Group AG's ownership in BUMI rose from 2.86% to 6.66%.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Acquires Approximately 288.6 Million SCMA Shares at Average 174 IDR
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), purchased about 288.6 million SCMA shares at an average price of 174 IDR per share between 21 March and 11 June 2025. The total transaction value was roughly 50 billion IDR. After the transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 63.63% to 64.02%.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Director Resigns; Arief Widyawan Sidarto Proposed as New Director
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral Internasional announced that its President Director, Alexander Ramlie, submitted his resignation on 14 June 2025 in connection with his planned appointment as a commissioner of the company. AMMN also announced that it has nominated Arief Widyawan Sidarto as the candidate for the new President Director. Arief currently serves as a director at AMMN. Both proposals will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPST) on 16 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: JTPE Announces 2024 Dividend of Approximately 164.5 Billion IDR (69% Payout)
tickerNews.content: Jasuindo Tiga Perkasa will distribute a 2024 dividend of about 164.5 billion IDR, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of roughly 69% (2023: ~69%). This amount equals a final dividend of 17 IDR per share and indicates a final dividend yield of about 6.5% on Monday, 16 June. The cum-date is on the regular market and the ex-date is 20 June 2025, with payment scheduled for 10 July 2025. Previously, JTPE paid an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of 7 IDR per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: KBLM Announces 2024 Dividend of 22.4 Billion IDR (20 IDR per Share)
tickerNews.content: Kabelindo Murni will distribute a 2024 dividend of 22.4 billion IDR, equivalent to 20 IDR per share. This amount corresponds to a dividend payout ratio of 29% (2023: ~29%) and indicates a dividend yield of about 6.5% on Monday, 16 June. The cum-date is on the regular market and the ex-date is 19 June 2025, with payment scheduled for 11 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: TLDN Acquires 99.99% of PT Cipta Davia Mandiri for 136 Billion IDR
tickerNews.content: Teladan Prima Agro (TLDN) announced that it has acquired 99.99% of the shares of PT Cipta Davia Mandiri for a transaction value of 136 billion IDR. This price is lower than the acquisition agreement announced in April 2025, which was in the range of 160-210 billion IDR. Previously, Kontan reported that PT Cipta Davia Mandiri manages approximately 3,100 hectares of oil-palm plantations, so the total planted area owned by TLDN will increase to about 63,500 hectares after the acquisition is completed.

tickerNews.title: PRAY Acquires Approximately 51% of PT Lynas Medikal for 17.3 Billion IDR
tickerNews.content: Famon Awal Bros Sedaya (PRAY) announced that it has acquired about 51% of the shares of PT Lynas Medikal for approximately 17.3 billion IDR from a non-affiliated party. The company also plans to purchase an additional 10% of shares for 3.4 billion IDR within one month after the acquisition date, bringing PRAY's ownership in PT Lynas Medikal to 61%. PT Lynas Medikal operates in the distribution of medical equipment and pharmaceuticals.

tickerNews.title: SDMU Plans Private Placement of Approximately 2.27 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Sidomulyo Selaras (SDMU) announced a private placement of about 2.27 billion new shares to convert debt of approximately 61.4 billion IDR owed to the controlling shareholder, Tjoe Mien Sasminto. The execution price is set at 27 IDR per share, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 66.68%. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 22 July 2025.
